intro: Hamiltonia propinqua, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hamiltonia propinqua is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
